expires.title: Date when artifact should expire must be in the future.

image.title: Docker image.
image.description: Image to use for the task.  Images can be specified as an image tag as used by a docker registry, or as an object declaring type and name/namespace

cache.title: Caches to mount point mapping.
cache.description: Caches are mounted within the docker container at the mount point specified. Example: ```{ "CACHE NAME": "/mount/path/in/container" }```

capabilities.title: Capabilities that must be available/enabled for the task container.
capabilities.description: Set of capabilities that must be enabled or made available to the task container Example: ```{ "capabilities": { "privileged": true }```

privileged.title: Privileged container
privileged.description: Allows a task to run in a privileged container, similar to running docker with `--privileged`.  This only works for worker-types configured to enable it.

devices.title: Devices to be attached to task containers
devices.description: Allows devices from the host system to be attached to a task container similar to using `--device` in docker.

loopbackVideo.title: Loopback Video device
loopbackVideo.description: Video loopback device created using v4l2loopback.

loopbackAudio.title: Loopback Audio device
loopbackAudio.description: Audio loopback device created using snd-aloop

phone.title: Phone device
phone.description: Phone device that will be created using Testdroid

sims.title: Sims
sims.description: Number of sims to be available in the device

build.title: Build URL
build.description: URL for the build the phone has been (or will be) flashed with

memory.title: Device Memory
memory.description: The memory configuration the device to be configured with

command.title: Docker command to run (see docker api).

encryptedEnv.title: List of encrypted environment variable mappings.
encryptedEnv.description: List of base64 encoded asymmetric encrypted environment variables. See https://docs.taskcluster.net/reference/workers/docker-worker/environment#encrypted-environment-variables

items.title: Base64 encoded encrypted environment variable object.

maxRunTime.title: Maximum run time in seconds
maxRunTime.description: Maximum time the task container can run in seconds

onExitStatus.title: Exit status handling
onExitStatus.description: By default docker-worker will fail a task with a non-zero exit status without retrying.  This payload property allows a task owner to define certain exit statuses that will be marked as a retriable exception.

retry.title: Retriable exit statuses
retry.description: If the task exists with a retriable exit status, the task will be marked as an exception and a new run created.

purgeCaches.title: Purge caches exit status
purgeCaches.description: If the task exists with a purge caches exit status, all caches associated with the task will be purged.

supersederUrl.title: URL of the a service that can indicate tasks superseding this one; the current taskId will be appended as a query argument `taskId`.  The service should return an object with a `supersedes` key containing a list of taskIds, including the supplied taskId.  The tasks should be ordered such that each task supersedes all tasks appearing earlier in the list.  See [superseding](https://docs.Taskcluster.net/reference/platform/taskcluster-queue/docs/superseding) for more detail.

localLiveLog.title: Enable live logging (worker local)
localLiveLog.description: Logs are stored on the worker during the duration of tasks and available via http chunked streaming then uploaded to s3

azureLiveLog.title: Enable live logging (via azure blobs)
azureLiveLog.description: Useful for situations where it is impossible to reach the worker and parsing the azure livelog is possible

bulkLog.title: Bulk upload the task log into a single artifact
bulkLog.description: Useful if live logging is not interesting but the overalllog is later on

taskclusterProxy.title: Task cluster auth proxy service
taskclusterProxy.description: The auth proxy allows making requests to taskcluster/queue and taskcluster/scheduler directly from your task with the same scopes as set in the task. This can be used to make api calls via the [client](https://github.com/taskcluster/taskcluster-client) CURL, etc... Without embedding credentials in the task.

balrogVPNProxy.title: Balrog proxy service
balrogVPNProxy.description: The Balrog proxy feature allows tasks to make requests to http://balrog which is a proxied connection through a vpn tunnel to production balrog update server.

balrogStageVPNProxy.title: Balrog stage proxy service
balrogStageVPNProxy.description: The Balrog stage proxy feature allows tasks to make requests to http://balrog which is a proxied connection through a vpn tunnel to the stage balrog update server.

dind.title: Docker in Docker
dind.description: Runs docker-in-docker and binds `/var/run/docker.sock` into the container. Doesn't allow privileged mode, capabilities or host volume mounts.

relengAPIProxy.title: Releng API proxy service
relengAPIProxy.description: The Releng API proxy service allows tasks to talk to releng api using an authorization token based on the task's scopes

interactive.title: Docker Exec Interactive
interactive.description: This allows you to interactively run commands inside the container and attaches you to the stdin/stdout/stderr over a websocket. Can be used for SSH-like access to docker containers.

allowPtrace.title: Allow ptrace within the container
allowPtrace.description: This allows you to use the Linux ptrace functionality inside the container; it is otherwise disallowed by Docker's security policy.
